'''Sonic the Hedgehog''' is a [[Marketplace]] adventure map that crosses over with the popular ''[[Minecraft x Sonic the Hedgehog|Sonic the Hedgehog]]'' franchise, featuring 29 skins that are based on characters from the series.

== Gameplay ==
{{Expand section}}
Gameplay is mostly just running through recreations of Sonic zones from the video games, and exploring the world of Sonic through Minecraft.

== Summary ==
=== Tails' Lab ===
The map begins inside of a garage, with the player facing a [[NPC]], teaching the player to build momentum by {{control|sprinting}}. Beside that is [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Omochao Omochao], who gives advice on [[performance]] issues, links to the bug tracker, and offers the options to help with time-based achievements and clear the Lab of decorations. Behind the sign is a large generator, surrounded by scraps, nuts, bolts, crates, toolboxes, and cardboard boxes, and behind Omochao is a TV screen with credits for the map. Circling the room are a mini obstacle course, lined with game elements and additional tutorials.

At the very start is a tutorial on collecting rings, followed by an explanation on how rings are lost. Proceeding from there are small pits lined with spikes, above them [[painting|notices]] for Gamemode One's social media, including their support again. Jumping over the spikes will lead to a spring, which can elevate the player to a tutorial on {{control|jumping}} on enemies beside [[beacons]]. Below is a live [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Moto_Bug Moto-bug], patrolling back and forth for the player to test fighting enemies, at the end a TV containing several rings. Passing by several rings will lead to a final screen, teaching the player to spin dash, with a breakable wall nearby to test it on.

Breaking through the wall reveals the rest of the Lab, introduced shrouded in darkness with flickering lights. Dropping down will activate the Warp Rings, which lead to the levels and begin lightening the room. Throughout the rest of the room are similar triggers, marked by a light ring, which will progressively reveal the utilities of the area. In the center of the room is a container of the Chaos Emeralds, which is filled up as progress is made finding them. In front of Green Hill is the [[achievement]] board, tracking 16 different achievements, and behind that is the [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Tornado_2 Tornado 2] be, beside a [[lectern]] listing patch notes. Right of the Tornado 2 is a spring up to a second layer of the Lab, approaching it opening a door into an area dedicated to Labyrinth Zone. Behind the spring is a storage area filled with props, with a light trigger bringing attention to a painting of a [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Neutral_Garden Chao Garden].

On the second floor of the Lab, a light trigger will be activated, identifying the spot as the "Comfort Zone." In this area, the player can select to play as any of the playable characters. Behind the first trigger is another, referring to a jukebox that allows the player to change the song in the Lab. From here the player has activated all the lights, and can freely play the game. Also in the Comfort Zone is Tails' Computer.

== Trivia ==
* In Green Hill Zone, the totem poles have appear to be the face of [[villagers]] carved into them.<ref>{{Citation|url=https://www.artstation.com/artwork/nEAAbX?collection_id=2766694|title=Sonic the Hedgehog | Minecraft DLC|author=John Newell|website=ArtStation|date=January 8, 2023}}</ref> Notably, the face appears to be modeled after their pre-[[Texture Update]] design.
* Many characters and items from the ''Sonic'' series make cameo appearances inside the Lab.
** Behind the Tornado 2 are [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Cubot Cubot] and [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Orbot Orbot], frequent sidekicks to Doctor Eggman, as well as the [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Gray_Wisp Gray], [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Black_Wisp Black], [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Purple_Wisp Purple], [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Pink_Wisp Pink], and [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Magenta_Wisp Magenta Wisps]. Between the Wisps is a painting of a [[creeper]].
** Behind Knuckles in the Comfort Zone are a [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/White_Wisp white wisp] and a hat, commonly associated with Knuckles due to its appearance in the 1996 [[w:Sonic the Hedgehog (OVA)|OVA]] and 2024 ''[[w:Knuckles (TV series|Knuckles]]'' series.
** Beside Sonic and the jukebox are chairs shaped like chili dogs, commonly regarded as Sonic's favorite food due to their prominence in the "[[w:Sonic the Hedgehog (TV series)|SatAM]]" and ''[[w:Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog|Adventures of Sonic the Hedgehog]]'' television series. Behind him is a painting of [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Angel_Island Angel Island] rising at the end of ''Sonic 3 & Knuckles''.
** Beside the coach Amy is sitting on is the [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Long_Hammer Long Hammer], an upgrade of her traditional [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Piko_Piko_Hammer Piko Piko Hammer] appearing in ''Sonic Adventure''. Behind her are a painting of the [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Death_Egg Death Egg], and [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Caliburn Caliburn], as it appeared in ''[[w:Sonic and the Black Knight|Sonic and the Black Knight]]''.
** Behind Tails in the Comfort Zone is a large bookshelf, containing many objects. At the bottom is a ''[[W:Sega Genesis|Sega Genesis]]'', the game console Sonic first appeared on, hooked up to a TV. On the second shelf are several copies of ''[[w:Sonic & Knuckles|Sonic & Knuckles]]'', the [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Shovel_Claw Shovel Claws], and [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Crystal_Ring Crystal Rings]. On the third shelf are the gauntlet worn in ''Sonic and the Black Knight'', and what appear to be the [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Jet_Anklet Jet Anklets]. On the top shelf is what appears to be a 1-Up, but is actually several issues of a Sonic book series, next to a creeper plush and [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Item_Box item capsule].
** In the Comfort Zone is a treadmill machine, seemingly based on ''[https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Sonic_Athletics Sonic Athletics]''.
** Underneath the Comfort Zone are many items and characters. Beside the garage switch are [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Orange_Wisp Orange], [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Red_Wisp Red], and [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Cyan_Wisp Cyan wisps]. Across from them on crates are the [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Jade_Wisp Jade wisp] and a model of the [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Speed_Star Speed Star]. Across from there on shelves are the [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Indigo_Wisp Indigo], [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Green_Wisp Green], [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Blue_Wisp Blue], and [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Violet_Wisp Violent wisps], as well as [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Froggy Froggy] and the [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Tails_Doll Tails Doll]. Finally, there are several [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Chaos_Drive Chaos Drives] on a [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Chao_Container Chao Container], [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Crimson_Wisp Crimson] and [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Ivory_Wisp Ivory wisps], [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Magic_Lamp Erazor Djinn's magic lamp], stacks of [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Medal#Sonic_Unleashed sun and moon medals], and the [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Blue_Star Blue Star] as it appeared in ''[[W:Sonic Free Riders|Sonic Free Riders]]''.
** Next to the ''Welcome to Labyrinth Zone'' terminal are the [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Dark_Rider Dark Rider], and the head of [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Heavy_Gunner Heavy Gunner]. On a nearby shelf are the [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Professional Professional], a [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Skateboard skateboard] that appeared in ''[[W:Sonic Generations|Sonic Generations]]'', a nonspecific [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Snowboard snowboard], the [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Wall_Jump_Shoes Wall Jump Shoes], [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Stomping_Shoes Stomping Shoes], and [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Air_Boost_Shoes Air Boost Shoes].
** In the Labyrinth Zone section are several paintings referencing the [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Sonic_the_Hedgehog_(film_series) Sonic film series]. On the left wall is one featuring Tom, [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Sonic_the_Hedgehog_(Paramount) Sonic], and [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Maddie_Wachowski Maddie], beside a [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Drone_(Badnik) Drone] and the head of the [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Heavy_King Heavy King]. On the opposite side of the room is Sonic in front of the moon, referencing the "Blue Justice" opening scene of the second movie, beside the head of the [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Heavy_Magician Heavy Magician].
** On Tails' Ancient Computer are several [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Gem gems], as well as a [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Red_Star_Ring Red Star Ring].
** Near the front of the Labyrinth Zone entrance is the [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Tornado Tornado], beside it the [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Bounce_Bracelet Bounce Bracelet], [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Rhythm_Badge Rhythm Badge], [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Flame_Ring Flame Ring], [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Warrior_Feather Warrior Feather], [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Hammer_Gloves Hammer Gloves], [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Sunglasses sunglasses], the head of [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Heavy_Shinobi Heavy Shinobi], and [https://sonic.fandom.com/wiki/Bomb_(Knuckles%27_Chaotix) Bomb] from ''Knuckles Chaotix''.
* {{Control|Attack|text=Clicking}} on the Tornadoes will allow the player to interact with them. The original Tornado will shake and spin its propellers, while the Tornado 2 can be ridden, briefly levitating into the air and turning into its jet mode. 
* In April 2025, Gamemode One released a joke responding to a larger [[April Fools' Day jokes|April Fools joke]] by SEGA, announcing that Tails would be renamed to Kilometres in the map.<ref>{{Tweet|SEGA|1907123335013495267|Official Statement: Miles 'Tails' Prower}}</ref><ref>{{Tweet|gmodeone|1907156431582699870|Wow, great decision, Mr. A Fools!<br><br>We checked in on Kilometers 'Tails' Prower, and they're excited for their new European Adventure üß°<br><br>Minecraft blocks are measured in meters, so this has simplified a lot for us.}}</ref>
